means: （尤指）职业拳击家，彪形大汉，粗壮的人

sentence.Network_en: He has a reputation as a political bruiser.
sentence.Network_cn: 他在政治上的好勇斗狠是出了名的。

list.abs: Hill-Wood isn't an insurmountable problem in terms of his shareholding [ less than 1 % ] , but he's a bruiser .希伍德依据他手中的股份（不到1%)虽然起不到什么关键作用，但是他是一个职业拳手。

entry.def: A bruiser is someone who is tough, strong, and aggressive, and enjoys a fight or argument.

example.ex: He has a reputation as a political bruiser.
example.tran: 他在政治上的好勇斗狠是出了名的。

means.word_mean: 1. a large and strong and heavyset man;

sentences.sentence: "he was a bull of a man"
"a thick-skinned bruiser ready to give as good as he got"

auth_sentence.content: There will be a big bruiser on the block shortly.
auth_sentence.res_content: There will be a big bruiser on the block shortly.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There will be a big bruiser on the block shortly.

auth_sentence.content: Ms Garrett-Cox, in contrast, is more of a corporate bruiser.

auth_sentence.content: Seymour Pierce is unlikely to be the last acquisition for this Brooklyn bruiser.
